content.html:
↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @darch I kind of agree that we can probably omit the nick part in mentions entirely. Since they can be looked up and cached, there's no need for this. But we'll have to spec this all up. First let's see what @lyse and @movq and others like @anth thing about finally formalising a standard way to lookup feed URI(s) and define a slightly more saner? @-mention syntax/usage pattern. I for one hate manually typing out (for example) @<darch https://neotxt.dk/user/darch/twtxt.txt> like this @darch üòÖ

@movq@www.uninformativ.de Yes üëå

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Turns out I'm not the only one who wonders what WebFinger is actually good for and why you'd bother using it.

@abucci@anthony.buc.ci It is however an RFC: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7033

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @darch this got me to thinking--since twt is a text-based format, it should be relatively straightforward to merge the history from one account into another. I haven't thought through the implications of that for threads/yarns or whatever, but at least at the level of the data format it's almost trivial to do. I wonder if that's something to explore?

The only noticeable thing you would see at all is all of a sudden (assuming you followed the old feed and new feed) you would see otherwise identical replies to some ‚Äúroot‚Äù that looks like its from two different identifies (feeds)

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @darch this got me to thinking--since twt is a text-based format, it should be relatively straightforward to merge the history from one account into another. I haven't thought through the implications of that for threads/yarns or whatever, but at least at the level of the data format it's almost trivial to do. I wonder if that's something to explore?

@abucci@anthony.buc.ci Actually it wouldn‚Äôt change any of the hashes at all. The old Twts from the previous feed‚Äôs URI would still remain in-tact. In the case of Yarn.social pods running yarnd, they are also archived, the search engine running at search.twtxt.net running yarns would also have indexed them already. Merging an old feed of yours from a different feed URI to a new one would have no impact whatsoever.
New Year, New Avatar üòÖ
content.value: New Year, New Avatar üòÖ

content.html:
↳ In-reply-to ¬ª test

@notvantablack@yarn.zn80.net Hey! üëã Welcome to Yarn.social ü§ó

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª think found a bug: when choosing a post as name in Goryon, the post cannot be send when the initial user is selected. Can someone verify that? iOS client.

@carsten@yarn.zn80.net Thank you! üôá‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @darch I kind of agree that we can probably omit the nick part in mentions entirely. Since they can be looked up and cached, there's no need for this. But we'll have to spec this all up. First let's see what @lyse and @movq and others like @anth thing about finally formalising a standard way to lookup feed URI(s) and define a slightly more saner? @-mention syntax/usage pattern. I for one hate manually typing out (for example) @<darch https://neotxt.dk/user/darch/twtxt.txt> like this @darch üòÖ

@movq@www.uninformativ.de There are two primary problems that the use of WebFinger can help solve (that I can think of):

  • Conveniently sharing your Yarn.social / Twtxt ‚Äúidentity‚Äù with others, much like other competing ecosystems have done. e.g: prologic@twtxt.net (which can be looked up now with a webfinger client)
  • Verifying @-mentions to be correct, potentially even rewriting them (yarnd does this anyway) to their proper @<url> form(s).

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Is there an easy way to get the timeline I read on twtxt.net timeline in RSS?

@rsdoiel Not easily at this time, no. We would have to build an API endpoint so you can authenticate and grab an Atom version of your Timeline. I have to ask though‚Ä¶ Why? üòÖ

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Hi there! As a novice (digging from a blog site -> that uses ASS -> that mentions twtxt in its one repo issue) here, I'm a bit confused when using Yarn pod site & Goryon Android APP.

@loopsaisei

@prologic Hey, I had no intent to complain or express frustration. Just really feel excited about what you ppl have created around twtxt and would like to engage to make things better.

This is awesome! üëå We welcome any and all help we can get! üôè We especially need help in the UI/UX side of things, especially on the Mobile App üëå

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @lyse I like the idea that you are still using the original client as a backend and ttis just a frontend. And would like to be able to use it one day

@darch@neotxt.dk Why? ü§î Clients like twtr and twete are just so much better üòÖ

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª open to building a new client? As a Go library and Cli?

@lyse@lyse.isobeef.org Well if you‚Äôre still up for it, I would be more than happy to write the client part itself, as a library that you could ‚Äújust import‚Äù. I‚Äôd probably base it on the code in yarnd but heavily refactor it and write a shittone more tests üòÖ Then eventually replace what yarnd uses too üëå

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @darch @prologic As briefly mentioned in https://twtxt.net/twt/23pnlzq, I still rely on the official twtxt client (that I patched up on a few ends) for downloading and managing subscriptions. So my config contains:

open to building a new client? As a Go library and Cli?

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª This day started out beautifully foggy but also very sunny and then quickly turned dark. At the bottom we still saw the streaming flag at the summit, but when we finally made it up, low hanging clouds had moved in and we didn't see anything. Oh well. Still a very nice hike.

@lyse@lyse.isobeef.org You always seem to pick the nicest shot üòÖ

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @lyse any idea how to fix this accoss pods and self hosted twtxt files?

@lyse@lyse.isobeef.org I think @darch@neotxt.dk was probably interested in how this bad mention happened in the first place‚Ä¶ So am I actually‚Ä¶ Can you shed some light on how this happened? ü§î

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @darch I kind of agree that we can probably omit the nick part in mentions entirely. Since they can be looked up and cached, there's no need for this. But we'll have to spec this all up. First let's see what @lyse and @movq and others like @anth thing about finally formalising a standard way to lookup feed URI(s) and define a slightly more saner? @-mention syntax/usage pattern. I for one hate manually typing out (for example) @<darch https://neotxt.dk/user/darch/twtxt.txt> like this @darch üòÖ

This probably arrants some real-time conversation though. Are you up for a call this weekend/tomorrow? ü§î

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @darch I kind of agree that we can probably omit the nick part in mentions entirely. Since they can be looked up and cached, there's no need for this. But we'll have to spec this all up. First let's see what @lyse and @movq and others like @anth thing about finally formalising a standard way to lookup feed URI(s) and define a slightly more saner? @-mention syntax/usage pattern. I for one hate manually typing out (for example) @<darch https://neotxt.dk/user/darch/twtxt.txt> like this @darch üòÖ

@lyse@lyse.isobeef.org I‚Äôm thinking of generally the case of solving the of ‚Äúbad data‚Äù when ti comes to @-mentions, typos, wrong urls and so on. In general if a client can validate an alias/mention (yes yarnd has a similar thing where we maintain a similar mapping per user and have lookup for that), then we can avoid this whole ‚Äúbad data‚Äù mess in the first place. I‚Äôd also be interested to know what folks like @anth@a.9srv.net was thinking too when he mentioned the use of WebFinger. Anyway we‚Äôll see how this pans out, yarnd (at least my pod) now has an experimental webfinger endpoint where you can do for example $ webfinger prologic@twtxt.net

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª I always thought that was pretty elegant because you don't need to host yet another discovery service and deal with all the maintenance and security headaches that entails. You just need a stable domain name and a web site you control.

Yeah that‚Äôs true I guess ‚Äì Bit of a downside ‚Äì But in theory you could probably do it with a static resource configuration ü§î

Haha no f**k Apple too üòÜ If it weren‚Äôt the only desent acccessible OS for a vision impaired person I wouldn‚Äôt use it ü§£

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @prologic cool, so can this be used to improve the data quality of various nicks on each pod? I don't see a "nick": field in the JSON

I mean yeah sure, yarnd already does this today really, based on what‚Äôs in your ‚ÄúFollowings‚Äù list on your account, which basically is a mapping of nick -> url of the feeds you follow. Really it could just be a simple list and we could drop the nick there too at some point (as again, we can just look them up and cache)

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @prologic cool, so can this be used to improve the data quality of various nicks on each pod? I don't see a "nick": field in the JSON

@darch@neotxt.dk Ahh you mean rewrite @-mentions into their fully formed Twtxt mention special URLs? ü§î
